description: Transitions Clinic is a unique primary care clinic dedicated to recently released chronically-ill men and women and their families. Transitional and primary care services are available within the first two weeks upon release from prison. Patients are supported by community health workers who have a history of incarceration. www.transitionsclinic.org

Contact Person.value: Ron Sanders, Juanita Alvarado, Joseph Calderon: Community Health Workers

notes:
Public Transportation: T Train, 54, 29
All patients are supported by trained community health workers with a history of incarceration. Our clinic partners with many community organizations and are we not funded by the criminal justice system.

keys: Referrals to other resources available as needed, including referral for employment, housing, mental health and substance use treatment
Medical care on site: buprenorphine (suboxone), optometry, podiatry, acupuncture, smoking cessation classes, lab services and nutrition
State-issued ID, Social Security Card, and Proof of SF Residency
No additional documentation needed prior to entry, but will need these documents in 30 days for San Francisco insurance program. Program will assist entering clients.
Men, Women, Transgender people, Pregnant women, and families.
